title: Formal vs Simulation — prove mutual exclusion for grants
description:
Scenario: Two arbiters might accidentally grant simultaneously — not acceptable. Explain when you'd use formal vs more simulation, and write an SVA property that asserts mutual exclusion for grant1 and grant2, describing any assumptions required for soundness.

Diagram (timeline):
  clk:   ↑   ↑   ↑
  grant1: 0   1   0
  grant2: 0   0   1

Also discuss Bounded Model Checking (BMC) vs induction for proving the property.

examples.output: Formal tools or simulation-based assertion checking find violations where both grant1 and grant2 are asserted simultaneously.
examples.explanation: Formal is excellent for exhaustive corner-case proof (deadlocks or mutual exclusion).

constraints: Formal checks typically require a reset and stable environment constraints for soundness.
hints: Explain Bounded Model Checking (BMC) vs induction.
Use formal assumptions to restrict environment.

solution.code:
property p_mutual_excl; @(posedge clk) !(grant1 && grant2); endproperty
assert property (p_mutual_excl) else $error("Mutual exclusion violated");
